answer_html: As the phi function computes the number of primitive roots modulo n, we are done.
answer_latex:
As the phi function computes the number of primitive roots modulo
\emph{n}, we are done.
hints_html: The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to \(\displaystyle \phi(n)\) provided that \(n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}\) for some odd prime p.
hints_latex:
The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to
$\displaystyle \phi(n)$ provided that $n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\}$ for
some odd prime \emph{p}.
hints_raw: The number of primitive roots modulo n is equal to <math> \displaystyle \phi(n)</math> provided that <math>n \in \{2,4,p^{k},2p^{k}\} </math> for some odd prime ''p''.
sols_html:
The answer is d = 42

We use the multiplicativity of the phi function to see that

\(\displaystyle \phi(98) = \phi(2\cdot 49) = \phi(2\cdot7^{2}) = \phi(2)\phi(7^{2}) = 7(7-1) = 42\)

As the phi function computes the number of primitive roots modulo n, we are done.
sols_latex:
The answer is \textbf{d = 42}

We use the multiplicativity of the phi function to see that

$\displaystyle \phi(98) = \phi(2\cdot 49) = \phi(2\cdot7^{2}) = \phi(2)\phi(7^{2}) = 7(7-1) = 42$

As the phi function computes the number of primitive roots modulo
\emph{n}, we are done.
sols_raw:
The answer is '''d = 42'''

We use the multiplicativity of the phi function to see that 

<math> \displaystyle \phi(98) = \phi(2\cdot 49) = \phi(2\cdot7^{2}) = \phi(2)\phi(7^{2}) = 7(7-1) = 42</math>

As the phi function computes the number of primitive roots modulo ''n'', we are done.
statement_html:
Multiple Choice

The number of primitive roots of 98 is

  • (a) 0

  • (b) 12

  • (c) 34

  • (d) 42

  • (e) None of the above.
statement_latex:
\textbf{Multiple Choice}

The number of primitive roots of 98 is

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  (a) 0
\item
  (b) 12
\item
  (c) 34
\item
  (d) 42
\item
  (e) None of the above.
\end{itemize}
statement_raw:
'''Multiple Choice'''

The number of primitive roots of 98 is

* (a) 0
* (b) 12
* (c) 34
* (d) 42
* (e) None of the above.
